reviews.review_msg: Very nice prof and very kind and helpful. Takes constructive criticism well.
She teaches very SLOW and you may have some problems with chapters which remain for last week! but is very kind and has good behavior.

not bad. I like her but not super like. she is a nice teacher. marking is somehow not really fair. i know some students who handed in essays late but got an A......anyway, overall is not bad :) recommended.

This is a course on reflection, not classroom management.  Very heavy workload.  Lorna is a challenging professor, but is also very flexible and deeply respects individuality.  The recent posting is a bit harsh.  Lorna has a high expectation level of education students; she wants you on the path that leads to self-discovery and higher learning.

Vague in directions, then critical of mistakes. Always refers to online material instead of material available in class, making it difficult for those not on a laptop. Teaches Classroom Management, but the class is mutinous and she doesn't understand why. I would never wish this on anyone, as she is condescending, patronizing, and sarcastic. Avoid!

I took this class with her, we basically use self evaluation, everyone gave them at least an A- I swear. And I think we are all very satisfied with overall mark, however, it's a confusing course. She didn't make statements of what she wants, we can basically do anything we "wanted" to do, if you let her know in advance. Very nice teacher, helpful.
everyone will be satisfied at the end of the class!
as long as you do your homework, you'll get an A.It's totally a GPA booster course
